decks.notes: The main strategy of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt your opponent's game plan through counterspells, hand disruption, and removal spells, while also utilizing graveyard manipulation with cards like Thought Scour and Unearth. The deck aims to control the game by denying your opponent resources and card advantage, eventually establishing a threat like Murktide Regent to close out the game. With a mix of removal, disruption, and win conditions, this deck seeks to out value and outlast its opponent in a grindy, control-oriented match-up.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the powerful combo of Underworld Breach and Grinding Station to achieve a loop that allows for infinite milling of your opponent's deck. This combo is supported by cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch, Mishra's Bauble, and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to help assemble the pieces and maintain card advantage. The inclusion of cards like Malevolent Rumble and Spell Snare provides disruption and protection for the combo. Additionally, Urza's Saga is included to fetch key artifacts like Grinding Station or Soul-Guide Lantern.

The deck focuses on utilizing Underworld Breach in combination with Grinding Station and Emry, Lurker of the Loch to loop through the graveyard, recasting spells and generating card advantage. Mishra's Bauble and Malevolent Rumble help fill the graveyard, while Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card selection. The deck includes various artifact cards like Mox Opal and Mox Amber for mana acceleration and Breeding Pool, Steam Vents, and Stomping Ground for color fixing. The goal is to set up a powerful combo turn that can lead to a win through cards like Grapeshot or through a breach loop.

This deck focuses on using ramp cards like Utopia Sprawl and Eldrazi Temple to quickly play powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. Control elements like Kozilek's Command and Karn, the Great Creator help to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes Kozilek's Return and Malevolent Rumble for extra removal and disruption. Overall, the deck aims to overpower the opponent with big threats while controlling the board and disrupting their game plan.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on playing aggressively with efficient creatures and burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It includes cards like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer to apply pressure while also using cards like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to control the board. The deck also includes a mix of utility cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Ranger-Captain of Eos to provide additional versatility. The mana base is optimized with fetch lands and includes powerful payoff cards like Arena of Glory and Ocelot Pride to further enhance the deck's aggressive strategy.

Using cards like Underworld Breach and Grinding Station, this deck focuses on setting up combos to generate a powerful win condition. The deck includes cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to help facilitate these combos. By utilizing graveyard interactions and artifact synergies, the deck aims to quickly assemble its pieces and overwhelm the opponent with a game-winning sequence of plays. By carefully managing resources and timing, this deck can quickly transition from setup to victory.

This Modern 1 vs 1 Aggro - Death and Taxes deck focuses on disruption and control through a combination of creature removal, flickering effects, and Aether Vial for mana efficiency. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while building up a board presence with powerful creatures like Solitude and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd. Utilizing Ephemerate and Flickerwisp effectively can lead to tempo swings in your favor. Recruiter of the Guard helps search for key creatures, enhancing consistency in your strategy. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure early on and control the board throughout the game.

The main goal of this deck is to quickly assemble and protect the combo of using Goblin Charbelcher to deal lethal damage to the opponent without ever needing to play a land. The deck focuses on utilizing disruption spells, countermagic, and card draw to enable its combo pieces and prevent the opponent from interfering. By efficiently cycling through the deck and consistently applying pressure, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a victory before they can establish their own game plan.

This deck focuses on quickly generating storm count and mana using cards like Pyretic Ritual and Manamorphose to cast powerful spells such as Ral, Monsoon Mage and Past in Flames. The deck aims to efficiently chain together spells in order to create a large storm count and finish off opponents with cards like Grapeshot. By utilizing card draw, mana acceleration, and spell recursion, this deck is designed to overwhelm opponents with a flurry of powerful spells in a single turn.

The main focus of this deck is to ramp up mana quickly using cards like Utopia Sprawl and Eldrazi Temple to be able to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. The deck also includes control elements such as Malevolent Rumble and Karn, the Great Creator to disrupt opponent's strategies. By combining Eldrazi ramp and control elements, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with powerful creatures while keeping them in check with removal and disruption spells.

The main concept of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan with a combination of hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and counterspells like Force of Negation and Spell Snare. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Unearth, while also providing card advantage with cards like Consider and Thought Scour. The win condition of the deck is to play powerful threats like Murktide Regent and Abhorrent Oculus, backed up by counterspells to protect them. Overall, the deck aims to control the game and outvalue the opponent to secure the win.

The deck focuses on quickly equipping creatures with powerful equipment like Colossus Hammer and Nettlecyst, utilizing abilities like Sigarda's Aid and Puresteel Paladin to do so efficiently. It aims to create a powerful threat early in the game, potentially utilizing Urza's Saga to search for key artifacts. The combo potential of quickly equipping creatures with powerful equipment like Colossus Hammer allows for explosive plays and quick wins. In addition, the deck includes some control elements like Shadowspear and Leyline Axe to deal with opposing threats.

This deck focuses on utilizing The Underworld Cookbook to generate value and create a fast-paced aggressive strategy. The key idea is to constantly fuel the graveyard with cards like Faithless Looting and Ovalchase Daredevil, while also utilizing powerful creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Inti, Seneschal of the Sun to apply pressure on the opponent. With a mix of burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Blast, along with artifacts like Urza's Saga and Mox Opal for mana acceleration, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of card advantage and efficient threats.

The deck revolves around utilizing a variety of creatures to create a toolbox-style combination that can be searched for and assembled using cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Chord of Calling. Agatha's Soul Cauldron helps enable the combo pieces to come together, with cards like Grist, the Hunger Tide and Yawgmoth, Thran Physician providing additional synergy and value. The deck aims to assemble powerful combos and disrupt opponents while maintaining a strong board presence through creatures like Orcish Bowmasters and Young Wolf.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize a combination of cards that focus on creativity and combo potential. By using cards like Indomitable Creativity, Fable of the Mirror-Breaker, and Persist, the deck aims to create powerful synergies and explosive plays. The inclusion of cards like Archon of Cruelty and Thoughtseize adds disruption to control the game and pave the way for the combo to go off. Utilizing a mix of fetch lands and powerful removal spells like Fatal Push and Lightning Bolt, the deck is looking to disrupt opponents while setting up its own win conditions.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful spells, focusing on a Boros color combination (white and red). The deck aims to quickly build a strong board presence with cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Seasoned Pyromancer, while also utilizing cards like Goblin Bombardment and Galvanic Discharge to deal direct damage to the opponent. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah provides additional support and synergy with the deck's creature base. Additionally, cards like Arena of Glory and Static Prison help control the battlefield and protect your own creatures.
